task_summary: Place the maroon cylindrical object down onto the table surface and safely retract.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DOF robot arm with a parallel gripper is already holding a small maroon cylinder over a white table. The scene contains a green bottle, a blue can, orange items on the right, and a clear cup. The goal is to approach a clear spot on the table, make controlled contact with the surface, release the maroon object, and retreat without disturbing neighbors. Motions should be straight and gentle during touchdown to avoid tipping.
preconditions: Maroon object is currently in the gripper
Target place area on the table is free of obstacles
Robot has collision model for table height
stepwise_plan: Verify the object is in hand
Move above the intended place spot
Approach and align precisely over the spot
Lower until contact with limited force
Retreat vertically to a safe height
success_criteria: Maroon object ends upright and stationary on the table
Gripper fully releases and retreats clear
failure_and_recovery: If contact is not detected within depth limit, re-approach and try again
If release slips object, regrasp if safe or choose a new spot
If alignment fails, repeat approach with widened tolerance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release and retreat to a safe clearance pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Verify the robot is holding the maroon object before placing.
Move to a pre-place height above the target spot.
Center and align over the place location with tight tolerance.
Descend gently until surface contact is detected or depth limit reached.
Release the maroon object on the surface.
Back off to a safe clearance height after placement.

failure_modes: Object not actually grasped at start
Premature contact without alignment causing tip-over
Object sticks to fingers after opening
Collision with nearby items during approach
recovery_strategy: Reconfirm grasp state and regrasp if needed
Redo approach with smaller step and tolerance
Nudge or slight lift-drop to detach then reopen
assumptions: Frames show the maroon cylinder already in gripper from the start; thus plan omits a pick step
Place target is a clear area on the table near scene center
No time or force modifiers present in instruction

expected_success_criteria: Object rests flat and upright; gripper clear
No secondary objects displaced beyond minor tolerance
